chargeHist.descr: Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine

result.execSummary:
The defendant Melany D. DeHaven was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(3)(a).
  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Assessment. treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by PO.

Credit for 2 days.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

Court questions deft as to waiver of prelim in 14CF632.
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.

State moves to:
14CF693 - D&RI entire file
14CF115 - Cts. 2, 4 and 5>>D&RI

14CF288 - Ct. 1>>D&RI
COURT GRANTS ABOVE

PLEA: 
14CF115 - Ct. 1 (Poss Para to Manufacture Meth/PTAC/2nd+ Offense)>>NO CONTEST
14CF115 - Ct. 3 (Poss of Cocaine 2nd+ Offense/PTAC)>>NO CONTEST
14CF288 - Ct. 2 (Poss Para)>>NO CONTEST
14CF632 - Ct. 1 (Poss Narcotic Drugs/2nd+ Offense)>>NO CONTEST

Atty Norgard gives statement on behalf of defendant - requests DNA sample and surcharge only be 

COURT ORDERS: 
On Felony counts - Sentence W/held - 4 Years Probation on each count, concurrent to each other and to Misd counts
On Misd count - Sentence W/held - 1 year Probation, concurrent to each other and to Felony counts
CONDITIONS: in 14CF115 - Ct. 3 only--6 months MCJ I&S any portion of which to be used for rule violations; 80 hours c.s. total; Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; CC including one DNA surcharge on each of 3 cases, and one DNA sample; Maintain absolute sobriety and submit for testing as required by PO; GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/FT schooling or combination thereof; AODA and any follow up as recommended; N/C with co-defendants as follows: Kayla Weiks, Gino Chiarello, Jennifer Burnett, Joseph Glenetski, Natasha Eldrige; Contact as allowed for by PO with Phillip McClure.

Credit if revoked, credit as follows: 14CF115-2 days; 14CF632-10 days; 17 days of time served in 14CF693 are credited to 14CF288
